parts.text:
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate. It focuses on a charitable fundraising campaign for children in vulnerable situations.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its message is clearly intended to reach a wide audience, soliciting donations for a charitable cause.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to raise funds for a charitable cause, not to influence the outcome of the parliamentary elections.  The content is focused on helping children in need during the Christmas season.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. While the post presents information about the campaign, it's primarily a call to action for donations, not journalistic reporting or analysis.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post doesn't express personal opinions; it presents factual information about the campaign and its goals.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1101485591385015</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes a charitable fundraising campaign for children in need, not electoral propaganda.  The campaign's timeframe (November 12th - December 17th) overlaps with the parliamentary election period, but the content itself is entirely unrelated to the election. There is no mention of any political party, candidate, or any attempt to influence voters' choices. The post's objective is purely charitable, aiming to collect donations for underprivileged children.  Therefore, it does not meet the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006 and Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>EduActiv</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
